main event: An unidentified flying object was sighted over Greenville, South Carolina on 15 March 1949.
interesting points: The object was described as round, fairly large, and grey., It was reported to be moving in a northeasterly direction at an undetermined speed., No sound or exhaust was observed from the object., Two witnesses reported the sighting, one being an employee at the Greenville Municipal Airport., The object was later determined to be a Geological Weather Service balloon.
witness description: One identified witness employed at the Greenville Municipal Airport and one unidentified witness.
